faithPrinciples.title: Principles of Faith
faithPrinciples.description: The six fundamental principles of Islamic faith. Detailed information about the core beliefs that every Muslim must affirm in their heart.
faithPrinciples.introText: Faith means to affirm with the heart, declare with the tongue, and practice with the limbs. In Islam, faith is based on six fundamental principles, and it is necessary to believe in all of these principles.
faithPrinciples.hadithText: Faith is to believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and divine decree both good and bad.

allah.title: Belief in Allah
allah.description: Believing in the existence, unity, and uniqueness of Allah. Having faith that He is the Creator, Provider, and All-Powerful.
details: Allah's existence and unity (Tawhid)
Allah's 99 beautiful names (Asma al-Husna)
Allah's attributes and characteristics
Not associating partners with Allah (avoiding Shirk)

angels.title: Belief in Angels
angels.description: Believing in the existence of angels created from light by Allah, who obey Him and never commit sins.
details: Gabriel (peace be upon him) - Angel of revelation
Michael (peace be upon him) - Angel of sustenance
Israfil (peace be upon him) - Angel who will blow the trumpet
Azrael (peace be upon him) - Angel of death

books.title: Belief in Books
books.description: Believing in the existence of holy books revealed by Allah to His prophets and that the Quran is the final book.
details: Quran - Revealed to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)
Gospel - Revealed to Prophet Jesus (peace be upon him)
Torah - Revealed to Prophet Moses (peace be upon him)
Psalms - Revealed to Prophet David (peace be upon him)

prophets.title: Belief in Prophets
prophets.description: Believing in the existence of prophets sent by Allah to guide humanity and that Muhammad (peace be upon him) is the final prophet.
details: Adam (peace be upon him) - First human and prophet
Noah (peace be upon him) - Prophet of the flood
Abraham (peace be upon him) - Friend of Allah (Khalilullah)
Muhammad (peace be upon him) - Final prophet

afterlife.title: Belief in the Day of Judgment
afterlife.description: Believing that resurrection after death, the Day of Judgment, Paradise, and Hell are real.
details: Resurrection after death (Ba'th)
Day of Judgment (Yawm al-Din)
Paradise - Place of the believers
Hell - Place of the disbelievers

destiny.title: Belief in Divine Decree
destiny.description: Believing that Allah knows everything in advance, has decreed it, and nothing happens without His permission.
details: Allah's knowledge of everything (Ilm)
His writing of everything (Kitabah)
His willing of everything (Mashi'ah)
His creation of everything (Khalq)
